g.H8438: the crimson-grub, but used only (in this connection) of the colorfrom it, and cloths dyed therewith
g.H8144: crimson, properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it
g.H4639: an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
g.H8336: bleached stuff, i.e. white linen or (by analogy) marble

g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
g.H5982: a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform
g.H2053: a hook (the name of the sixth Hebrew letter)
g.H7218: the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
g.H2838: attached, i.e. a fence-rail or rod connecting the posts or pillars
g.H2091: gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
g.H134: a basis (of a building, a column, etc.)
g.H5178: copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver)
